marketNews.title: MSCI Global Standard, Small Cap, and Micro Cap Index Review Announcement
marketNews.content: MSCI announced evaluations for the Global Standard, Small Cap, and Micro Cap stock indexes, effective November 25, 2025. The details are as follows: MSCI Indonesia Global Standard Inclusion: BRMS, BREN. Exclusion: KLBF, ICBP. MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Inclusion: DSNG, ENRG, MSIN, RAJA, WIFI, TINS, KLBF. Exclusion: BRMS, SMSM, ULTJ. MSCI Indonesia Micro Cap Inclusion: -. Exclusion: -. Although TINS was mentioned in the initial announcement as entering the MSCI Small Cap index, MSCI later announced that TINS's entry was canceled because its shares were in the full call auction special monitoring board during the review process. This is in accordance with the MSCI methodology change that we previously wrote about. The next evaluation will be announced on February 10, 2026, with an effective date of March 2, 2026.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway from MSCI Review
marketNews.content: Of the issuers entering the 'Global Standard' index, BRMS experienced a decline of -5.88% while BREN strengthened +1.79% in trading on Thursday (6/11). On the other hand, KLBF experienced a deeper decline (-5.3%) compared to ICBP (-1.44%), even though KLBF is still included in the 'Small Cap' index. This mixed price movement indicates that some market participants have anticipated the MSCI review results. For the upcoming index review, investors need to monitor developments regarding MSCI discourse on free float calculation, which will have implications for the potential entry/retention of a stock in the MSCI index. The consultation results regarding this discourse will be announced before January 30, 2026.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Finance Plans to Propose Rupiah Redenomination Bill to DPR
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance plans to propose a Rupiah redenomination bill to the DPR, with discussions targeted to be completed as early as 2026. This proposal is contained in Minister of Finance Regulation No. 70/2025 concerning the strategic plan of the Ministry of Finance for the period 2025-2029. Rupiah redenomination aims to increase economic efficiency, maintain Rupiah stability, and enhance currency credibility. This discussion is not new, considering the strategic plan of the Ministry of Finance for the period 2020-2024 also included a proposal for rupiah redenomination, but it did not materialize.

marketNews.title: ESDM Targets Feasibility Studies for 18 Downstreaming Projects to Be Completed in December
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Thursday (6/11) that the feasibility study for 18 downstreaming projects worth more than IDR 300 trillion proposed by the Downstreaming Task Force will be completed in December 2025. These projects consist of 8 mining and mineral projects, 2 energy transition projects, 2 energy resilience projects, 3 marine and fishery downstreaming projects, and 3 agricultural downstreaming projects.

marketNews.title: US Services PMI Rises in October 2025
marketNews.content: The Institute for Supply Management recorded that the Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) in the US rose to 52.4 in October 2025 (vs. September 2025: 50), exceeding the consensus expectation of 50.8, marking the strongest services sector expansion since February 2025. This result was supported by the recovery in business activity and new orders, while employment remained in contraction. The Head of the Institute for Supply Management, Steve Miller, stated that there were no indications of widespread layoffs or workforce reductions, but respondents noted that the government shutdown since early October 2025 impacted business activity and would raise concerns about future layoffs.

tickerNews.title: SSIA's Land Sales Down -87.3% YoY in 9M25 Amidst Low Realization Against Target
tickerNews.content: SSIA: Surya Semesta Internusa recorded marketing sales of 18 hectares valued at IDR 352.6 billion during 9M25. Based on area, this realization only met 13.1% of the 2025 target of 137 hectares and decreased by -87.3% YoY from the 9M24 realization which reached 141.8 hectares valued at approximately IDR 1.7 trillion. This decrease was primarily due to the high-base effect from land sales to BYD in Subang Smartpolitan last year. From the construction business, Nusa Raya Cipta (NRCA) recorded new contract value of approximately IDR 2.6 trillion during 9M25 (-17.3% YoY), equivalent to ~69% of the 2025 target of IDR 3.75 trillion.

tickerNews.title: BBNI in Talks for USD 825 Million 5-Year Syndicated Loan with Record Low Margin
tickerNews.content: BBNI: Bloomberg reported that Bank Negara Indonesia is in discussions to secure a 5-year syndicated loan worth USD 825 million with an interest margin of SOFR + 70 bps, which is the company's lowest loan interest rate ever for that tenor. Bloomberg sources stated that the funds from this loan will be used for working capital up to refinancing. The facility is reported to be led by 6 banks, including Bank of China Ltd., China Construction Bank Corp., and HSBC Holdings Plc. BBNI has not yet responded to this news. Bloomberg reported that BBNI's low interest offer indicates increasing competition amid a decline in US dollar loans this year. According to Bloomberg records, the volume of USD loans in Asia excluding Japan - excluding bilateral facilities - has fallen -22% since the beginning of the year to about USD 118 billion, marking the lowest year-to-date level since 2010.

tickerNews.title: CBRE Charters Newly Acquired Pipe-Laying Vessel for 8 Years
tickerNews.content: CBRE: Cakra Buana Resources Energi leased 1 unit of a newly acquired pipe-laying and lifting vessel to a non-affiliated party with an 8-year time charter contract. The contract has a daily hire basis rate of USD 90,000 per day, with a standby rate of USD 50,000 per day.

tickerNews.title: HEAL CEO Purchases 2.25 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: HEAL: The President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Yulisar Khiat, purchased approximately 2.25 million HEAL shares at a price of IDR 1,442 per share on November 6, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 3.2 billion. After this transaction, Yulisar Khiat's direct ownership portion in HEAL increased from 6.2% to 6.21%.

tickerNews.title: SMKM's Prospective New Controller Plans Transformation to Regional Aquaculture Company
tickerNews.content: SMKM: The prospective new controller of Sumber Mas Konstruksi, Lim Shrimp Org Pte. Ltd., stated that it will transform SMKM into a regional aquaculture company, with assets and businesses in Indonesia, Malaysia, and Singapore. Post-acquisition, Lim Shrimp Org plans to utilize the SMKM platform as a means for fundraising and will develop a pipeline of potential acquisition targets as part of a vertical and horizontal integration strategy to strengthen the company's business position regionally. Lim Shrimp Org itself purchased approximately 313.3 million (25%) SMKM shares from PT Vina Nauli Jordania at an average price of 37 rupiah per share on October 27, 2025, where this transaction is the first stage of a total acquisition of up to 450 million (35.91%) SMKM shares.

tickerNews.title: FOLK Plans Private Placement of 394.8 Million New Shares for Business Development
tickerNews.content: FOLK: Multi Garam Utama plans to conduct a private placement of up to approximately 394.8 million new shares with a dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The offering price and prospective investors have not been announced, while the proceeds are intended for business development and working capital. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on December 12, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BLUE in Acquisition Talks for 80% Stake by Hong Kong Company
tickerNews.content: Berkah Prima Perkasa (BLUE) announced that Dragonmine Mining (Hong Kong) Limited, a Hong Kong-based company, is in the process of negotiating to acquire 80% of BLUE shares from existing shareholders including Herman Tansri, Siek Agung Guntoro, Fajar Tasrif, Rudy Tasrif, and PT Cetak Biru Kapital. The transaction value has not been announced. Upon completion of this transaction, Dragonmine Mining (Hong Kong) Limited will become the new controller in BLUE and carry out a mandatory tender offer in accordance with the provisions of POJK No. 9/2018.

tickerNews.title: PPGL to Distribute 2nd Interim Dividend for 2025 at IDR 4 per Share
tickerNews.content: Prima Globalindo Logistik (PPGL) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year of IDR 4 per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~2.9% as of Thursday (6/11). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is November 13, 2025, while payment will be on November 28, 2025. This is the second interim dividend distribution for the 2025 fiscal year from PPGL, following the distribution of an interim dividend of IDR 3 per share in August 2025.

tickerNews.title: MCOL Commissioner Buys 1.09 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Prima Andalan Mandiri (MCOL) Commissioner, Diah Asriningpuri Sugianto, purchased approximately 1.09 million MCOL shares at a price of IDR 3,800 per share on November 5, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 4.14 billion. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of Diah Asriningpuri Sugianto in MCOL increased from ~0.08% to ~0.11%.
